name: Scottish Environment Protection Agency Hydrometric Data
description: Provision of Hydrometric Open Data to professional users via API

SDGs.evidenceText: This solution allows the free, open provision of Hydrometic data (river, loch, sea, groundwater levels and flows, and rainfall) - this data underpins water supply across Scotland and United Kingdom and allows clean water and appropriate sanitation to be put designed and managed.

This solution allows the free, open provision of Hydrometic data (river, loch, sea, groundwater levels and flows, and rainfall) - this data allows the design and operation of hydropower schemes and tidal barrages that produce affordable clean energy.

This solution allows the free, open provision of Hydrometic data (river, loch, sea, groundwater levels and flows, and rainfall) - this data underpins water supply across Scotland and United Kingdom and underpins flood defence scheme, water distribution network design, flood risk assessment to ensure critical national infrastructure and housing is build outside of the floodplain, the real-time open nature of the datasets allows new innovative services to be designed and produced

This solution allows the free, open provision of Hydrometic data (river, loch, sea, groundwater levels and flows, and rainfall) - this data being freely and readily available allows quicker cheaper flood risk analysis, avoiding inappropriate development,  enabling flood defence design, sustainable urban drainage and flood warning, all of which contribute to sustainable cities and communities

This solution allows the free, open provision of Hydrometic data (river, loch, sea, groundwater levels and flows, and rainfall) - this data allows the calculation of chemical loads, understanding available dissolved oxygen etc which in turn allow an understanding of what is required for healthy aquatic life.

This solution allows the free, open provision of Hydrometic data (river, loch, sea, groundwater levels and flows, and rainfall) - making this data freely and readily available allows us to see the impact of climate change on weather and its impacts across Scotland.  Having the data available also allows communities and cities to develop realistic adaptation plans bearing in mind climate change impacts such as increased flood risk and greater water scarcity

NonPII.nonPIIAccessMechanism: Provision of Hydrometric Open Data to professional users via API

bestPracticesList: Semi-user focussed approach, we engaged users on what the service would do and whether the proposed solution met their requirements.  Because there was a readily available solution we did need to develop our own so instead procured it and not engage in user centric design etc.  Our focus was instead on checking the solution and guidance would meet user needs

preventHarm.additionalInfoMechanismProcessesPolicies: We provide a disclaimer encouraging users to assess and determine whether the data is suitable for their purposes

dataPrivacySecurity.privacySecurityDescription: Users can access and download the data without any form of registration, however to protect the system there is a daily limit per IP address.  Users may register for an API key, where we store limited information (name, company, email address) at registration to enable us to provide the key and contact them if they have any difficulties.  A full Data Protection Impact Assessment was carried out and the data is securely stored.
